item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ivory Coast's Marie-Josee Ta Lou misses medal on day eight
item.description: Ivorian Marie-Josee Ta Lou finishes fourth in the women's 100m final at the Tokyo Olympics as Ivory Coast and Egypt are knocked out of the men's football.

item.title: Nigeria's kidnap crisis: 'I saw my two-year-old carried by a man with a gun'
item.description: Parents of schoolchildren abducted in Nigeria describe their trauma, and dilemma over the ransom demands.

item.title: South Africa 27-9 British and Irish Lions: Springboks level series in fiery encounter
item.description: The British and Irish Lions' series with South Africa will go to a decider after the Springboks win a fiery second Test 27-9 at Cape Town Stadium.

item.title: Nigerian sprinter Okagbare fails drugs test
item.description: Nigerian sprinter Blessing Okagbare is out of the Tokyo Olympics after being suspended for failing a drugs test.

item.title: Kenya's President Uhuru Kenyatta criticises 'vaccine nationalism'
item.description: Kenyaâ€™s President Uhuru Kenyatta says vaccine nationalism is why he wants his country to move towards vaccine production.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics 2020: 'I'm Nigerian and Ghanaian, but I compete for Ghana'
item.description: Triple jumper Nadia Eke talks dance, jollof and wellbeing as she prepares to compete at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Siya Kolisi 'didn't feel respected at all' in first Test
item.description: South Africa captain Siya Kolisi says he "didn't feel respected at all" by the referee in the opening loss to the British and Irish Lions, backing claims made by Rassie Erasmus.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 23-29 July 2021
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: South Africa riots: The inside story of Durban's week of anarchy
item.description: The worst unrest since white-minority rule ended has left deep scars, especially in the coastal city of Durban.

item.title: Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue and his love of Bugattis and Michael Jackson
item.description: Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue, tipped as Equatorial Guinea's next leader, is under sanctions in the UK and France.

item.title: Zimbabwean with football dreams to be kicked out of UK
item.description: Christopher Arundell grew up in the UK but after doing time in jail is being deported to Zimbabwe.

item.title: Covid in Tanzania: Vaccination campaign gets underway
item.description: President Samia Suluhu's decision to have a Covid vaccine marks a change of approach for Tanzania.

item.title: Sunday Igboho: What's stopping Benin extraditing the Nigerian separatist leader?
item.description: Nigeria's plan to have Sunday Igboho extradited are fading as he faces criminal accusations in Benin.

item.title: Kenyans sue the British army over fire at wildlife sanctuary
item.description: Some 1,000 people are going to court after a fire destroyed 12,000 acres of land at a wildlife sanctuary.

item.title: Nigerian outrage at brazen bandit attacks
item.description: The shooting down of a military jet shows how organised crime is becoming more daring by the day.

item.title: Nigeria's hipster herders - the funky Fulanis
item.description: Fulani herders are usually found in forests herding cattle but when they go to cities, they dress in style.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: What's stopping aid getting in?
item.description: A renewed surge in fighting has made it ever more difficult for aid to reach areas in desperate need.

item.title: Niger President Mohamed Bazoum on the importance of keeping girls in school
item.description: Niger President Mohamed Bazoum says that his country must work hard to keep girls in school.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Kenya's runners form 'mum's club'
item.description: Top Kenyan female athletes have been juggling parenting and training for the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Malawiâ€™s president Lazarus Chakwera defends bringing family to London summit
item.description: Malawiâ€™s president has brought family members on a UK trip but says they were needed for the event.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics 2020: Refugee weightlifter Cyrille Tchatchet on his journey
item.description: Cyrille Tchatchet has gone from despair to representing the Refugee Olympic Team in Tokyo.

item.title: Is there a future for Africa's lions?
item.description: As lion populations decline across much of Africa, could community-led conservation help reverse this trend?

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: Mali insurgency: Investigating corruption allegations in the military
item.description: Africa Eye investigates the cycle of death, violence and corruption in Mali's military.
